title: Macrotasks
description: The Macrotasks in JS are low-priority asynchronous tasks in the event loop that are executed after the current execution stack and microtask queue are cleared.
content: The low-priority asynchronous tasks in the JavaScript event loop that are executed after the current execution stack and microtask queue are cleared, following the completion of any synchronous code. Examples include I/O (input/output) operations, `setTimeout()` and `requestAnimationFrame()` callbacks.
